item.description:
Three films for the price of one. What a deal at the Wadsworth Atheneum on Valentines Day. The three films are:

2:00 pm 1957 "An Affair to Remember" with Cary Grant and Deborah Kerr
A man and a woman who are involved in other relationships fall in love and agree to meet in six months at the Empire State Building in New York City.


4:00 pm 1989 "When Harry Met Sally" with Billy Crystal and Meg Ryan
Comedy ensues when platonic friends who have known each other for years contemplate having sex.


5:30 pm 2005 "Pride and Prejudice" with Donald Sutherland, Keira Knightly and Brenda Blethyn
A humerous tale based on Jane Austen's novel about five sisters living in Georgian England and how their lives are turned upside down by the arrival of a wealthy young man and his friend.

Come for one or stay for all three. It is also the opening day of the "Reunited Masterpieces" Exhibition.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: Triple the Romance-3 Movies for the price of one
